citations.narrative:
***The facility recently obtained two olive baboons. Baboons are categorized as Group 5 non-human primates and the
facility's current license does not authorize the use of non-human primates from this category. In addition the current
license authorizes a total number of animals of 100. The facility currently holds 112 animals and has therefore exceeded
the authorized number of animals.
Please submit an updated application to include the additional category of Group 5 nonhuman primates as well as an
increase in the total number of regulated animals held on property at any one point in time. The application may be
submitted to the USDA Main Office at the address below:
USDA, APHIS, Animal Care
2150 Centre Avenue, Building B
Mailstop #3W11
Fort Collins, CO 80526-8117
The application may also be completed on-line on the USDA website or sent in by email to animalcare@usda.gov.
Correct by September 23, 2024.

***USDA observed a large accumulation of flies in the hoofed stock enclosures. Several animals were observed twitching
ears and stomping feet in response to the presence of the flies. The current program of pest control for flies does not
appear to be effective to prevent the animals from being pestered by flies. The excess presence of flies may cause
discomfort and increase the risk of disease hazards.
An appropriate and effective program for fly control shall be established and maintained to provide for the health and well-
being of the animals.
Correct by September 5, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Manager.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
***The facility recently obtained two olive baboons. Baboons are categorized as Group 5 non-human primates and the 
facility's current license does not authorize the use of non-human primates from this category. In addition the current 
license authorizes a total number of animals of 100. The facility currently holds 112 animals and has therefore exceeded 
the authorized number of animals. 
 
Please submit an updated application to include the additional category of Group 5 nonhuman primates as well as an 
increase in the total number of regulated animals held on property at any one point in time. The application may be 
submitted to the USDA Main Office at the address below: 
 
 USDA, APHIS, Animal Care 
 2150 Centre Avenue, Building B 
 Mailstop #3W11 
 Fort Collins, CO 80526-8117 
 
The application may also be completed on-line on the USDA website or sent in by email to animalcare@usda.gov. 
 
Correct by September 23, 2024. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
***USDA observed a large accumulation of flies in the hoofed stock enclosures. Several animals were observed twitching 
ears and stomping feet in response to the presence of the flies. The current program of pest control for flies does not 
appear to be effective to prevent the animals from being pestered by flies. The excess presence of flies may cause 
discomfort and increase the risk of disease hazards. 
 
An appropriate and effective program for fly control shall be established and maintained to provide for the health and well-
being of the animals.

Correct by September 5, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Manager.
